title: Ticket #7825: Skip blahp check of proxy symlinks on refresh when not needed
description:
Vanderbilt ran into errors with their CEs that would occur after the Gridmanager sent a GM_REFRESH_PROXY command [1] to the Blahp. The Blahp creates symlinks in the user's home directories that point to the location of the old proxy. These are needed when the blahp creates a new proxy file as part of job submission (when the blahp is configured to create a limited proxy for the job and when glexec is used). Neither of these cases occurs with HTCondor-CE. The blahp checks for the symlink on a proxy refresh even if these options aren't in use. Vanderbilt turned out to not have a home directory for the user in question so the Blahp failed when the Gridmanager told the Blahp to renew the proxy at the symlink location.

The blahp should be fixed to not check for the proxy file symlink when it's not needed. Additionally, the gridmanager could be given a parameter to suppress the GM_REFRESH_PROXY command to the blahp.

[1] https://ggus.eu/index.php?mode=ticket_info&ticket_id=148149
